titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: anniversary of the Declaration of War is being celebrated today with religious services. Our principal function is reserved for next Sunday afternoon, but we mark the day by a celebration of Holy Communion at 8 a.m.; and by special intercessions at Mattins & Evensong. I was the celebrant; and there were about a score of communicants. M

Lowe brought a party of Anzacs to see the Cathedral. I shewed them round the Church, the Library, the Monks' Garden, & the Dean's Kitchen. They were all Australians, very pleasant and interested, but, perhaps, a little dazed. Then I attended Evensong, & read the special prayer afterwards. Colonel Darwin & Gilbert came in to tea, and stayed talking for some while.
